**Repentance for Transgressions**

For any transgression resulting in the revocation of talismans or registers, or their loss, one must submit a petition of repentance and apology, generally as follows:

[State], [Prefecture], [County], [Village]: Male/female [name], age [years], prostrates and knocks their head to the ground, begging forgiveness and mercy.

I, [name], a mere blade of grass, have presumptuously encountered the great transformation. I beg for your compassionate nurturance and the gift of life’s essence. On [date], I received the register of [name], but in my actions, I violated the statutes and incurred divine scrutiny. On [date] at [time], in the matter of [event], I offended public or private affairs, transgressing against the Three Honored Ones. By the master’s command, my disciples have revoked the talisman of [name] I wore. Or, on [date] at [time], in [location], during [event], I lost the talisman of [name] I wore. I confess this truthfully, taking full responsibility. Even if I were to die, it would be no recompense—like sparing a sparrow or mouse, I dare to beg for the mercy of renewal. I vow to cleanse my heart and innards, hoping for the grace of revival. I shall reform my past and cultivate my future, never again repeating my former ways. I humbly beseech your mysterious compassion to grant a great pardon, allowing these withered bones to regrow flesh, these dried roots to sprout anew. With reverence, I submit to the statutes and offer restitution as prescribed. May your boundless mercy forgive me, and may I, though indebted, live on. Overwhelmed by your purity and majesty, I am drenched in sweat and trembling. I respectfully submit this petition.

[Date] at [time], the petition is presented.

After receiving the petition, the master shall assess the severity of the transgression and, in accordance with the statutes, report it to the higher authorities. The talisman or register shall be reissued as appropriate. For three losses or three transgressions, one may not receive again. For extraordinary merits and exceptional virtues, one must wait twenty-five years before being eligible to receive anew.

Extraordinary merits and exceptional virtues cannot be fully enumerated. To summarize broadly: one may follow the examples and apply them accordingly. Such merits include: employing talent to benefit the world, using civil and martial arts to rectify the times, establishing governance and abodes, propagating the Dao’s influence, transforming evil into good, upholding justice and eliminating wickedness, dedicating one’s nation or family to the Three Treasures, devising far-reaching strategies, exorcising ghosts and vanquishing bandits, pacifying the four directions, stabilizing the state, rescuing the dying and aiding the living, revitalizing the Daoist teachings, exhausting one’s strength and wealth without regret or retreat. Those capable of such are deemed to possess extraordinary merits and exceptional virtues.

**No Merit After Receiving the Register**

For any transgression, one must repent immediately, without delay. If the transgression occurs at the hour of *yin*, it must be addressed before *mao*. If circumstances prevent timely repentance, the day shall not be counted. If one fails to repent within three days, the penalty doubles. If one fails to repent within nine days, the repentance shall not be accepted. If absolved within nine days, one must perform meritorious deeds within three days thereafter. If one fails to perform meritorious deeds within nine days, they are deemed foolish, obstinate, base, and vulgar, incapable of self-improvement. Alternatively, they may be aged, impoverished, or ill, lacking the means; or a child yet unenlightened, with parents too ordinary to act on their behalf. Thus, their merits remain unrecorded for years. If, after a long time, they suddenly perform extraordinary deeds, they shall advance in accordance with their virtue, as determined by an enlightened master.

**Merit After Receiving Protection**

After receiving the register, whether three or nine days, or upon completing the repentance period, one shall offer restitution as prescribed and be reinstated according to the statutes, regardless of the transgression’s severity. Those who subsequently perform extraordinary deeds shall be promptly gathered and treated accordingly.

For those whose registers were revoked due to transgressions but later reinstated, the same statutes apply as for lost registers. They must offer restitution and provide meals for the worthy, ensuring no deficiencies. The master shall retrieve their original register and contend for it according to the Dao. For those whose registers were revoked or lost, a full cycle of repentance must be completed before the master submits a petition for divine scrutiny.

Formerly, on [year, month, day, hour], I approached my master—or the Celestial Master [Name]—to receive the register of [Official Rank] and the Generals’ retinue, with their officers and soldiers, securing years of peace. Yet my conduct often violated the precepts, piling sins like mountains, inviting divine censure and punishment. Unintentionally, I lost my register on [year, month, day, hour], whether at home or elsewhere, due to public or private coercion, flood, fire, theft, or banditry—truthfully stated. I searched but could not recover it, fearing it was burned, destroyed, or taken by villains. Your servant, though but flesh and bone, humbly submits this petition, wishing the overseeing officials to review and consider it. According to the statutes, I confess my lost register and submit to punishment, beseeching mercy to be reinstated in the Nine Palaces. I shall separately request re-inscription. I humbly dispatch the Merit-Officer Messenger and Reviewing Lords to verify the truth of this flesh-bound petitioner. May penalties be commuted to rewards, and may I be restored to my office as before. As a latecomer to the teachings, my time under the Dao’s transformation has been brief, and I remain ignorant of right and wrong. Now, I shall take responsibility, offering [Number] of [Items] to redeem myself, fulfilling the requirements of the registers’ statutes. Respectfully submitting this document: Due to my misconduct, faults have accumulated. On [Month, Day, Hour], I carelessly lost the registers of [Number] Generals that I wore.
